data.title: Art Exhibition Council Bluffs & Art Exhibition Omaha
data.meta_description: Be a part of the local art scene. Visit the PACE calendar for updates on new art exhibitions in Council Bluffs and art exhibitions in Omaha.
data.text:
PACE NEW MASTERS 2024

Presented by Kathleen Pyper

Exhibit run dates: May 24-Sep 28, 2024

Join us for the 3rd annual PACE New Masters. This juried exhibition features 40+ professional photographers depicting realism landscapes, figures, and portraits.

Come to the opening night festivities as we celebrate these talented artists and award the winning artist with $2,500, the coveted PACE Gold Medal, and named “PACE Photographer of the Year!”

The jury selected artists featured in New Masters include: Ilaamen Pelshaw, Reagan D Pufall, Gregory D. Brown, Lisa Saarela, Alicia M Brady, Robert Ervin, Chris Holtmeier, Lisa Hartman, Kenneth Smith, Jeremy S. Kruse, Jennifer Finney, Kandi McCool, Christopher Ruhaak, Sharonda Harris-Marshall, Emilia Van Ert, Todd Gift, Svitlana Kay, Laura Snyder, Scott Sumpter, Buck Christensen, Emily Bauer, Larry Covalciuc, Tim Guthrie, Stein Hordvik, Betni Kalk, Sedra D, Bart Vargas, Jeremy Rose, Monica G. Maxwell, Chris Machian, Shelly Eisenhauer, Angie Jennings, Alessandra Petersen, Sarah Schroeder, Ken Petersen, Joe Shearer, Emily Globe, Brittney Thompson, Cody Smith-Finken (Awkward Tooth) and Terry Koopman.

RICHARD & DEANNA MILLER GRANT WOOD GALLERY

"Early Days of Kanesville"

Fri 6-9PM & Sat 12-4PM

Experience one of Grant Wood’s paintings, “Early Days of Kanesville.” This beautiful piece of early Council Bluffs heritage, painted in 1927 by world-renowned artist Grant Wood, to our gallery for the community to enjoy. Iowa artist, Grant Wood, best known for his work "American Gothic," was commissioned by hotel magnate Eugene Eppley in 1927 to create two murals at the new Hotel Chieftain in Council Bluffs, titled the “Corn Room” and “Early Days of Kanesville”. The 19-foot-by-6-foot mural “Early Days of Kanesville” was based on paintings and sketches by George Simons, the first artist to call Council Bluffs his home. Simons worked as a cook for the surveying party of railroad pioneer Grenville Dodge. Between meals, Simons made drawings which provided the earliest pictorial record of Council Bluffs during the early 1850s, documenting the landscape as it appeared in pioneer times.

RICHARD & DEANNA MILLER GRANT WOOD GALLERY

Grant Wood Corn Room Murals

Explore the artwork of and Grant Wood in this permanent exhibition. Grant Wood is incredibly important to the history and culture of Council Bluffs, explore the agricultural landscapes of the region painted by Grant Wood Himself. Join us as we rediscover these significant pieces as part of our local history.

DICK MILLER GRANT WOOD ARCHIVE HIGHLIGHTS
